contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{Infobox Prime Minister | name = Dragiša Pešić<br>Драгиша Пешић | image = <!-- only free-content images are allowed for depicting living people - see [[WP:NONFREE]] --> | order = 5th [[Prime Minister of the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia]] | term_start = 24 July 2001 | term_end = 7 March 2003 | president = [[Vojislav Koštunica]] | predecessor = [[Zoran Žižić]] | successor = Position abolished | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1954|8|8}} | birth_place = [[Danilovgrad]], [[People's Republic of Montenegro|PR Montenegro]], [[Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia|FPR Yugoslavia]] | death_date = | death_place = | party = [[Democratic Party of Socialists of Montenegro|Democratic Party of Socialists]]<br>[[Socialist People's Party of Montenegro|Socialist People's Party]] | spouse = | nationality = [[Montenegrins (ethnic group)|Montenegrin]] | religion = [[Serbian Orthodox Church|Serbian Orthodox]] }} '''Dragiša Pešić''' ([[Serbian Cyrillic alphabet|Serbian]]: Драгиша Пешић) (born 8 August 1954 in [[Danilovgrad]], [[Montenegro]], [[Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia]]) is a [[politician]] from Montenegro who was the last [[Prime Minister]] of [[Federal Republic of Yugoslavia]] before it was officially transformed into the [[Serbia and Montenegro|State Union of Serbia and Montenegro]] in February 2003. He studied economic sciences at [[University of Sarajevo]]'s Faculty of Economics. In 1998, he became a Minister of Finance in [[Belgrade]], when the [[Slobodan Milošević|Milošević]] trusted friend and SNP leader at that time [[Momir Bulatović]], a competitor of Đukanović, became Yugoslav head of the government. After the fall of Milošević, [[DOS]] needed on the Yugoslav federal level the SNP for majority formation, because Đukanović had boycotted the last Yugoslav elections and openly national independence was explained as the goal. He is currently the vice-president of the [[Socialist People's Party of Montenegro]]. ==External links== * [http://www.snp.co.me/strana.asp?kat=1&id=90 Biography on SNP Official Site] {{sr icon}} {{s-start}} {{succession box|title=[[Prime Minister of the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia]]|before=[[Zoran Žižić]]|after=position abolished|years=2001–2003}} {{s-end}} {{Prime Minister of FR Yugoslavia}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Pesic, Dragisa | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Montenegrin politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 8 August 1954 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Danilovgrad]], [[People's Republic of Montenegro|PR Serbia]], [[Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia|FPR Yugoslavia]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Pesic, Dragisa}} [[Category:1954 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Danilovgrad]] [[Category:Socialist People's Party of Montenegro politicians]] {{Montenegro-politician-stub}}
